message: Bo Rood - nice attempt troll. The first state-wide Conservative Party was founded in my neighbor's living room with help from my parents and Bill Buckley who they backed as mayor of New York against the Republican and Democratic machines. I am a lifelong conservative who worked to get Congress in our hands in 1995. Enjoy your DC establishment kool-ade
They already killed her.

For the people saying its no big deal maybe you don't realize it's against regulations to walk and use a cell phone in any military uniform. When she gets to her duty station that will be a rule she is expected to follow just like every other military service member.
Gross

I think millenials have it right. It must be much harder for them to serve because they are seeing what violence and injustice does. I'm not complaining about the Corps, I'm just saying they have a different world view. And distrust for the government has increased. After all there were no weapons of mass destruction in Iraq after all. Nothing in Afghanistan can ever truly be won. 9/11 happened somehow while we're out involved in something on at least every continent... Just feel bad for millenials going through this whole women in combat roles transition. Old Corps grunts and anyone with a CAR will fight it to the death. The Corps is trying to recruit millenials but there's a price to pay. Stress cards, womens empowerment, LGTBQ friendly, transgender friendly. It's a new world my friends. Maybe it's a step in a better direction.
